text: Built in 1868, Temple Emanu-El was a large New York synagogue that was later demolished. In 1868, Emanu-El erected a new building for the first time, a Moorish Revival structure by Leopold Eidlitz, assisted by Henry Fernbach at 43rd Street and 5th Avenue after raising about $650,000. It was demolished in 1927. == Sources == * Kathryn E. Holliday, Leopold Eidlitz: Architecture and Idealism in the Gilded Age. New York: W. W. Norton, 2008, p. 71 ff. * https://nyc-architecture.com/GON/GON025.htm == Image == * https://emanuelnyc.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/1860sEmanuel.jpg Category:Reform synagogues in New York City Category:Religious organizations established in 1868 Category:Demolished buildings and structures in Manhattan Category:Buildings and structures demolished in 1927 Category:Religious buildings and structures completed in 1868
title: Temple Emanu-El (New York, 1868)
